sn1.36:1: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in Jeta's Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika's Park. Then, when the night had advanced, a number of devatas belonging to the Satullapa host, of stunning beauty, illuminating the entire Jeta's Grove, approached the Blessed One. Having approached, they paid homage to the Blessed One and stood to one side.
sn1.36:2: v.117"Faith is a person's partner;If lack of faith does not persist,Fame and renown thereby come to him,And he goes to heaven on leaving the body."
sn1.36:3: Then another devata recited these verses in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn1.36:4: v.118"One should discard anger, cast off conceit,Transcend all the fetters.No ties torment one who has nothing,Who does not adhere to name-and-form."This verse is identical with v.10except that in pāda d saṅga replaces dukkha. On the five ties, see n.12.
sn1.36:5: v.119"Foolish people devoid of wisdomDevote themselves to negligence.But the wise man guards diligenceAs his foremost treasure.
sn1.36:6: v.120"Do not yield to negligence,Don’t be intimate with sensual delight.For the diligent ones, meditating,Attain supreme happiness."sn.i.2
